qas.question: What percentage of Florida was African american in 2010

answers.text: As of 2010, those of African ancestry accounted for 16.0% of Florida's population

qas.question: what percentage of florida was black in the early 1900's

answers.text: During the early 1900s, black people made up nearly half of the state's population

qas.question: What did many black migrate from florida

answers.text: response to segregation, disfranchisement and agricultural depression, many African Americans migrated from Florida to northern cities

qas.question: Where does the African population in florida have ancestry roots

answers.text: African slaves brought to the US south, there are also large numbers of blacks of West Indian, recent African, and Afro-Latino immigrant origins

qas.question: What percentage of Florida was African American in 2001?
What percentage of Florida was black in the late 1900s?
In 1960 the population of African Americans increased by what percent?
What percentage of Jamaicans were in Florida in 2001?
Southern and Eastern Florida have the highest population of what race?

context: <a0_0>As of 2010, those of African ancestry accounted for <b4_0>16.0%<b4_0/> of Florida's population<a0_0/>, which includes African Americans. Out of the 16.0%, 4.0% (741,879) were West Indian or Afro-Caribbean American. <a1_0>During the early 1900s, black people made up nearly <b5_0>half<b5_0/> of the state's population<a1_0/>. In <a2_0>response to segregation, disfranchisement and agricultural depression, many African Americans migrated from Florida to northern cities<a2_0/> in the Great Migration, in waves from 1910 to 1940, and again starting in the later 1940s. They moved for jobs, better education for their children and the chance to vote and participate in society. By 1960 the proportion of <b8_0>African Americans<b8_0/> in the state had declined to <b6_0>18%<b6_0/>. Conversely large numbers of northern whites moved to the state.[citation needed] Today, large concentrations of black residents can be found in northern and central Florida. Aside from blacks descended from <a3_0>African slaves brought to the US south, there are also large numbers of blacks of West Indian, recent African, and Afro-Latino immigrant origins<a3_0/>, especially in the Miami/South Florida area. In 2010, Florida had the highest percentage of West Indians in the United States, with 2.0% (378,926) from Haitian ancestry, and <b7_0>1.3%<b7_0/> (236,950) Jamaican. All other (non-Hispanic) Caribbean nations were well below 0.1% of Florida residents.
